website_summaries.verdict: If you’re on the fence about using cloth diapers, but want something more environmentally friendly than disposables, pairing these biodegradable inserts with a diaper cover is solid choice.
pros: Convenient and eco-friendly with cradle to cradle certification
Made of natural materials including cellulose and wood fluff pulp
Highly absorbent to prevent leaks and rashes
Made for gDiapers, but can be used with other diaper covers
cons: Can start to bunch a bit when wet

customer_reviews.title: No plastic, very absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. We use them for overnight and travel with a cloth diaper cover (not the G diaper cover, though). We use cloth most of the time and these are a nice accompaniment. I can see someone using these with a cover instead of disposables as their regular routine. I like that there is no plastic as part of the construction of the insert. They’re just as absorbent, if not more, than a regular disposable diaper. I even prefer these to the Grovia inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Devin MCarthy

customer_reviews.title: So ecologically friendly - no diaper rash.
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper system. We love the flushable inserts. By using the inserts, we eliminate our diapers going into a landfill, and we eliminate water usage and heating associated with cleaning cloth diapers all the time (not to mention the huge time suck). We just flush diapers each time we need to use the restroom, so no extra flushes either. This is a wonderfully earth-friendly choice for diapering. We are currently using these for our second child, little to no diaper rash. Plus, you can double them up for nighttime - no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: K. Poby

customer_reviews.title: Switch today !
customer_reviews.text: Great product, so much better for the environment! I can barely stand the guilt each time we toss a regular diaper in the trash knowing it will take 500 years to degrade - how terrible is this? Recommend to everyone to switch to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Rash on Baby's Bum
customer_reviews.text: It is really sad that these gDiaper disposable insert did not work for us. My son developed a bad rash with these on the first use and it continued to get worse even if I change him every 2hrs. I thought I could resolve the rash with diaper cream so he can continue using these but I had no luck. I had to stop using these or my son's rash will get even worse. It took a week after stopping its use before the his rash healed with a special concoction I found on pinterest. Anyway, I wish I just bought a small pack to try first before buying these...
customer_reviews.author: sierralime

customer_reviews.title: We love gdiapers and these inserts do
customer_reviews.text: We love gdiapers and these inserts do, in fact, fit all of the sizes listed on the package - medium, large, and extra large. They are pretty absorbent but we are finding that overnights are our limiting factor and they simply can't hold enough for our tummy sleeper to sleep straight through without leaking. We have some leftover size smalls so are planning to try to layer one of those under the medium tonight to see if that can remedy the issue temporarily but I really wish gdiapers would release an "overnight" version of the disposable insert as well.
customer_reviews.author: monkeysohana

customer_reviews.title: Great option for those who cloth diaper and need something for travel
customer_reviews.text: We cloth diaper our baby and have since birth. We were intrigued by the G-Diaper because it decomposed so quickly. We use these when we travel, or when we are expecting an extra messy diaper. They work great and we have rarely had leaks. The actual G-Diaper pant is very soft and the leg elastic won't leave red marks on your baby's legs. Personally we don't flush the diapers, but have occasionally and they do flush completely. I just worry about overloading our plumbing. I could also see a disposable diaper user being able to make the switch to the G-Diapers very easily. They are very little hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen M.

customer_reviews.title: A great option for green moms who don't have time to mess with cloth dipaers
customer_reviews.text: I've used Gdiapers for both of my kids and they are great. I want to give a couple of pointers: This size did not do as well in my water system as the smaller ones. this size got stuck and I had to get the plunger out on multiple occasions. I just started throwing them away. It's still better than using a disposable diaper for the environment, but less stress worrying out my water pipes getting clogged. This worked for my daughter until she was about 18 months, then they didn't fit well once she got more active, and they would leak. great product for babies and toddlers up to 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: sfollett

customer_reviews.title: I love GBaby Diapers!
customer_reviews.text: GBaby diapering system is an awesome combo of cloth and disposables. We have been using them for several months now and they are easy to use and I feel much better about the environmental effects as opposed to regular disposables. I have tried many other cloth diapers and always had a problem with leakage and diaper rash. I have tried flushing the Gbaby inserts, and they flush well in the toilet, however I prefer just throwing them away in the garbage. I stuck one in my compost tumlber to see what happened and it did break down relatively quickly. Overall I am very satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: LaniDee

customer_reviews.title: Great hybrid diaper!
customer_reviews.text: I love these inserts for when I am out and about and not willing to use the cloth inserts. These have been super absorbent for both of my boys and I plan and using them again for #3. Its great that they can be flushed (no need for diaper pail), and RARELY do my kids leak in these. I just appreciate that G-diapers has an awesome product for people trying to reduce their ecological footprint, but who realistically cannot always manage cloth diapers (at the zoo, long car rides).
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Roo

customer_reviews.title: Not for weak plumbing
customer_reviews.text: If we all used Gdiapers, we could make a pretty big difference. Landfills are clogged with disposable diapers and they aren't going anywhere. These, however, go into the septic system and we haven't had a problem with that yet. I will say that you need good plumbing to handle them. We visited a friend and clogged her toilet; any guess how much it costs to have root-rooter come on short notice? About $200. So we learned our lesson. Only flush them if you are certain they are going to make it down.
customer_reviews.author: luu

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Pricey but worth it for us- the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Pricey but worth it for us- the only insert that doesn't give my son wicked diaper rash. We don't flush them but will compost once we have a compost bin. They stay put even when the soaked parts bunch slightly (unlike flip which rolled into a ball).
customer_reviews.author: mpf5007

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER!
customer_reviews.text: FAST SHIPPING COMPARED TO GDIAPERS.COM, SAVED ME FROM HAVING TO BUY DISPOSABLES WHICH WAS GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: A.Watts

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers period.
customer_reviews.text: Best diapers out there. They keep leaks in overnight better than Honest diapers and keep rashes away. My husband likes the honest so he doesn't have to tear and flush these but they are so much more absorbent and better for the environment and never give our daughter diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: LBPD

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I like these alot! We put them in our "humanure" compost as we compost inatead of flushing and feela great to have so much less waste. They absorb alot and we put them in regular diaper covers and it works just fine!!
customer_reviews.author: tess

customer_reviews.title: Used with covers
customer_reviews.text: I've never used gDiapers but I bought these for on the go to use with my diaper covers and I love them. Will buy more as I'm going to be out soon 😊 They last pretty long! (He's pictured in a BestBottom diaper cover)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rose

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!!!
customer_reviews.text: I Love gDiapers, especially the "Flushies"! I have 4 children, 2 of them under the age of 2, so I needed something quick & easy when I go to change them. Not to mention the savings compared to disposables. They don't bunch. They're not bulky like some other brands can be. They're easy to use. Best of all, they are eco-friendly! I reccomend them to anyone who is thinking of using a reuseable cloth diaper system but doesn't want the extra laundry. Thank you gDiapers!
customer_reviews.author: TexasMomOf4

customer_reviews.title: gDiaper flushable inserts
customer_reviews.text: I had tried many different cloth diaper systems and was not entirely happy with any of them. My daughter is long and very lean, so most diapers were so bulky on her and never fit snug around her legs. These fit wonderfully, work great and don't make her look like she is sitting on a barrel when she has them on. I love the fact that they can compost or flush and I am not harming the environment. gDiapers diapering system gets two thumbs up from this mom!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A. Chenard

customer_reviews.title: Idk
customer_reviews.text: Returned because they were the size of a normal diaper
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Malone

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for all prior shipments...but
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered a few cases of these and they are great! This last case was not as good as the others. They were not as absorbant and I had some break apart getting the clear gel beads all over my son (ugh, that's what I hated about Huggies with my first (now 7). I'm going to order one more case to see if they are making them different now or if I just got a dud last time, then I'll try gCloth.
customer_reviews.author: Paty Kay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These non-plastic biodegradable refills are amazing. We put my 6 month old son to sleep in them and he does not leak at all. He will usually be in those diapers for 8-10 hours. We also use them when we go out for the day because we want to make sure he does not leak onto his nice clothes. It is such a great product, and it does not accumulate in the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: Great disposable insert option
customer_reviews.text: We love the gDiaper disposable inserts and use them with various brands of cloth diapers. We use them while traveling and for bad yeast diaper rashes and they've worked perfectly. The size is a little awkward as we have to fold it a little bit to get the insert to fit in any diaper. I get that the size is supposed to fit up to XL, but it might have made more sense for the company to do a S/M size and L/XL size. Also, while they do hold a lot of urine, it tends to collect mainly in the front so we do double up at night and haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Bad reaction
customer_reviews.text: Previously I'd bought inserts directly from gDiapers, but to save a few bucks I thought I'd get them here... BAD IDEA! My son developed a horrible rash 2 days after we started using this pack! So sad, I really do love gDiapers but we had to switch to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Aneika

customer_reviews.title: I love this system!!
customer_reviews.text: No stinky, plastic and feces shoved and squeezed into a container in your babies room to sit there until emptied only to rot in a landfill forever 🤢 I love this system!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but good things: ) minimal chemicals and super absorbent
customer_reviews.text: We use these every night and when we're traveling. Don't know where I'd be without them! Most absorbent diaper ever!! Nothing but good things :) minimal chemicals and super absorbent, doesn't get any better. I always recommend these, even to people who don't cloth because you could stick them in a regular diaper for extra absorbency.
customer_reviews.author: Joshedgestone

customer_reviews.title: If you ever need a disposable, this is a good choice
customer_reviews.text: Our family has chosen to go the g-diaper cloth diaper route the great majority of the time, but these disposable inserts are really helpful when it comes to older baby's overnight diapers and when baby is sleeping on long car rides and it would be terrible to pull over and wake her up just for a diaper change. It's never a good feeling for me to throw away a diaper, but these make me feel ever-so-slightly better. And if they're just wet, they can be composted!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All babies are different but gDiapers just don't work with ...
customer_reviews.text: All babies are different but gDiapers just don't work with my baby, especially the disposable inserts, which is a shame because these diapers are really cute and plush feeling. Breastfed liquidy poop always leaked out of these when they never did in my Thirsties covers.
customer_reviews.author: Novel Living

customer_reviews.title: LOVE gDiapers
customer_reviews.text: We have been using gDiapers for our daughter since we brought her home from the hospital. She's 6 months old now. We absolutely love the flexibility of cloth AND disposable. We don't have any issues with leaks -- even overnight (and she sleeps 10-12 hours). Amazon definitely has the best price on the case of inserts. Especially with the Amazon Mom program. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good diaper
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these over the generic diapers for the environmental impact and also the baby's comfort. They are very absorbant and my son seems doesn't sweat from the contact like you sometime see on the waistband of traditional diapers. they are biodegradeable, but will also disintegrate in your toilet for easy flushing.
customer_reviews.author: Mphs1976

customer_reviews.title: The best diaper
customer_reviews.text: gDiapers are the best. They take a bit of getting used to, but after a day are soooo easy to use. No plastic means better for the environment too! Easy to dispose of with no guilt, flush, toss or compost. My daughter has had no diaper rash or issues at all with this diaper. I would never use another brand of diaper.
customer_reviews.author: K. Green

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These inserts make traveling while cloth diapering way easier, plus they pull apart, and flush entirely down the toilet with minimal work. The inserts themselves are super absorbent, with rarely a problem with leakage or spillage. Each case lasts a while too, even with a busy toddler.
customer_reviews.author: N S

customer_reviews.title: says they're flushable...
customer_reviews.text: good absorption, but not really flushable (especially if you have an eco-toilet). It says they are flushable, but they do not go down well in either conventional or eco-toilet, even if you let them soak. Cheaper here on Amazon than Babies-R-Us, but not worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: LaShuna

customer_reviews.title: Environment
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use , more green option than regular disposables.
customer_reviews.author: kayla rogers

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out for Clogs
customer_reviews.text: Not disposable at all. The liner material crystallizes in really cold water and will not clear with a plunger. A router has to be used. The SAP chemical forms a hard ball and plungers don't work.
customer_reviews.author: C. W. Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love gDiapers. They're the perfect hybrid. Cloth regularly, but use the disposable inserts when we travel and at night.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Good for the earth, great for my little one
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I hotly debated the cloth vs. disposable question quite a bit in the months before we were parents. gDiapers are a GREAT compromise. The convenience of a disposable with the eco-friendliness of a cloth. So happy we found them and Amazon's price (if you do the monthly subscription) can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love gDiaper refills!
customer_reviews.text: I use these during the day and whenever we go out (at night I use cloth - mostly to save on the expense, and because I "double stuff" my daughter at night because how wet she gets). But the fact that these are easy on the environment and flushable makes the extra bulk in my diaper bag worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Anisah M

customer_reviews.title: Extremely expensive, but very effective. Slightly cheaper from ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely expensive, but very effective. Slightly cheaper from the gDiapers website. Using only when out and about because too pricey to use all the time. Only 3 stars because of the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke's Mom

customer_reviews.title: We love our G-diapers!
customer_reviews.text: We use the disposable inserts when baby goes to bedtime. In the morning the insert is completely full, soaking up however much our 8 month old pees through the 11 hours he sleeps. No leaks. Easy to dispose, though if you have old or bad pumping, I would recommend doing multiple flushes.
customer_reviews.author: Tamami

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these for almost 2 months now and we love them! There is a learning & adjustment period to getting fit just right to prevent leaks. Both grandma's who watch my daughter have even adjusted and love how great the diapers are for her skin and the earth!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: disposable inserts
customer_reviews.text: These are nice to use, however I do find that they bunch up in the front area. They are also a little too long for size med diapers. You can use them in other diaper covers (other than just gdiapers) which is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the environment and cool casing but they leak. They can't get too full or else the gel on the inside oozes out. Poor for overnight. Too expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Tara T

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, great product
customer_reviews.text: These liners are a great value. I really like being able to have them shipped directly to my home. They were listed as damaged packaging, but the liners were in perfect condition. Purchased at an approximate $10 savings per case.
customer_reviews.author: BlessedMommaof4

customer_reviews.title: Best diapering system
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, no diaper rash and work great!! Very absorbant!!
customer_reviews.author: ginger

customer_reviews.title: luv gdiapers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using gdiapers for the last 9 months and love them. I have a 2 kids in them, a 2 yr old boy and 1 yr old girl. They take a few days to get used to, but once you get the hang of it you will never want to use a disgusting disposable again. It's so easy to tear, swish and flush the insert. You can even compost the wet ones if you're into composting. And you no longer have to live with the guilt of A)putting a toxic filled plastic disposable on your child and B)filling up our landfills with human waste filled disposables that take 100's of years to decompose! Yea gdiapers!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Schwisow

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, breathable, and hypoallergenic. They hold better than the leading brand of disposable diaper on the market.
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: great absorbency, no leaks
customer_reviews.text: great absorbency, no leaks, hold a large amount, and they dont break or release the gel substance like other diapers do. i love these inserts
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient an absorbent
customer_reviews.text: We usually use the gcloths, but at night and when we are out, these biodegradable inserts are great. They are more absorbent than the cloth and help prevent leaks at night, and you can easily just toss them.
customer_reviews.author: A Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Don't understand all the hype
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these so badly. I bought them before my daughter was born to be prepared, but they turned out to be awful. They leaked like crazy. Maybe I wasn't using them correctly, but I did what the directions said with washing them 5 times and I even tried them in different sizes when she got a little older, but still leaks. My husband said he wasn't going to use them anymore so I returned what I could back to amazon, but still have one pack from Babies R Us that I couldn't. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Glad there are gDiapers
customer_reviews.text: As a new mom, I didn't have any experience with diapers and used mainstream diapers for my newborn. However, they made her diaper skin red and gave her rashes. I tried gDiapers and have been using them since. They are very absorbent and mild to my baby's skin. As long as I change her diaper every 2-4 hours, she has never had a diaper rash. My only complain is the velcro of the gPants becomes less sticky over time. It didn't happen with the small size pants. It happened to the medium size pants after 4 months of usage...
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you like to use cloth diapers and want to be quick on the go!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutly love gDiapers in general. The refills are very nice when you are on the go and want to be quick when changing diapers. Because I noticed when my daughter is in cloths, it is harder to put the cloth insert into the wetbag and then you have to worry about that stinky insert! Cloths are good for at home use. But I am on the go most of the time, and I don't like putting her into the chemicals that are in disposables. Also, a neat thing is that, these refills flush down any toliet becuase they disolve like salt in water!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, absorbent
customer_reviews.text: We use these for night time. We actually use them with other diaper brand shells (Flip). Comfortable, absorbent, and longlasting. And then right into the compost.
customer_reviews.author: BRobichaud

customer_reviews.title: The bomb!
customer_reviews.text: We use them at night; they're great! They absorb we'll and retain more fluid than a double stuffed gCloth diaper at night. Sometimes we double stuff a gInsert but mainly put a gInsert on top of a gCloth for night time sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Phelpsies

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for all three of my kids. I love knowing that they are better for the environment plus they are so cute in all the variety of colors offered. Great purchase, I would highly recommend to anyone! I did a lot of research on many different brands and found this to have the most qualities I look for when diapering my child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: gDiapers are great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used gDiapers for several kids. I am a foster parent, and any time I have foster kids - even if just for the weekend, babysitting for a friend - I use gDiapers. They are environmentally friendly, easy to use, comfortable for the kids, and helped my little ones potty train at a very young age. Since the inserts are disposable and/or flushable, they add hardly any laundry at all. I highly recommend gDiapers!
customer_reviews.author: Karmin

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: We love diapers and it is super nice having cloth or disposable option! Cloth at home and slip in an insert for when we are away. The best of both worlds!
customer_reviews.author: 4boyznogirlz

customer_reviews.title: Flushable, Biodegradable, Compostable....
customer_reviews.text: What other disposable diaper product offers such a great benefit to the environment. Leaving a future for our children, not only convenience for today. I am very pleased. JP
customer_reviews.author: j.p.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ALTERNATIVE TO CLOTH DIAPERS!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using gDiapers since our son was born in July 2008. These diapers are super absorbent and seem to last longer than regular diapers. We also noticed that he's had fewer rashes when wearing gDiapers versus regular diapers. Besides, you can get the shells in funky stylish colors. Yes, disposal can be messy (not as messy as cloth diapers), but saving the planet for our little one is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dablackmaestro

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product as it's the only biodegradable product on the market but I feel it's designed poorly. No leaks but you still have to clean #2 mess off the plastic liner which isn't pleasant. I keep buying it because it's also flushable. Could be less expensive too considering it's not the whole diaper but just the insert. Overall I'm happy with it but just not 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Yulia Kushnir

customer_reviews.title: Love G's!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my g's and the flushable refills. We can go forever without leaks! It does take a lot of practice to make sure you don't overtightened them since that will break the seal. I have been using mine for 3 years now and don't have any issues. I used them on my 3 year old and my 9 month old. There is a g diaper yahoo group that is full of mom and dads that can help you out if you have leaks. We only leak if we go longer than 2 1/2-3 hours or sometimes at night.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bund

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent, no diaper rash
customer_reviews.text: These are very absorbent. But not for overnight. My kids have both used them and never have diaper rashes. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Worked and good for the earth
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed using the gDiapers for my daughter. They worked well for a daytime diaper, looked adorable, and were good for the earth. I did need to use a disposable extra absorbent diaper for overnight however. I only stopped using them because my daughter outgrew them - she has extremely thick thighs! I will definatley purchase again for use with any future children.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: these work great and we LOVE the color/pattern options of the outside ...
customer_reviews.text: These things work perfectly. We hardly ever have accidents. We have not tried putting these in the toilet yet. We were concerned they would clog the toilet. Otherwise, these work great and we LOVE the color/pattern options of the outside diaper covers.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not so flushable
customer_reviews.text: Don't try to flush these if you have old (our house was built in the 50's) pipes!! We just paid $700 to get our sewer cleaned out, and guess what was causing the problem?? The outer material does NOT break down. I still plan to use gdiapers because I think it is a great idea for the environment, but we will have to toss them instead...
customer_reviews.author: pinniped

customer_reviews.title: Great Diapers, wish everyone could hear about them.
customer_reviews.text: gDiapers are the best kept secret among diapers. They are super convenient, easy, absorbent, and cute. You feel good using these knowing that you are doing something to help keep the earth green. These diapers work better than disposable too! They absorb well and because of the great fitting outer cloth layer, everything is kept in... no messy accidents. I highly recommend these diapers.
customer_reviews.author: PuppyLover

customer_reviews.title: Best eco-friendly option out there
customer_reviews.text: We chose gdiaper over other cloth diaper brands because of the grefills option. They are flushable, compostable and break down completely. Great for sitters, vacations, and on the go.
customer_reviews.author: sandraravens

customer_reviews.title: Might not come as a case
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a case, and what I got was 4 of the packs wrapped together tightly with strong tape. When I tried to carefully remove the tape, it still ripped open all 4 of the packs. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Sploxy

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, they work so great! Much better than disposables and better for the environment!
customer_reviews.author: christina golden

customer_reviews.title: Disposable inserts save our lives!!!
customer_reviews.text: Disposable inserts are great!! We use 2 at night and NO leaks at all. Amazon always has a fantastic price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travel
customer_reviews.text: These are great for when your out an about with your G diapers. You can throw them away so its less to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Biodegradeable and Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to use. Very absorbent. Even my daycare mom is happy to use them. Great for when you are out running errands and don't want to use cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Psyched about this diaper system
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for 8 months and am so psyched about this system.
customer_reviews.author: Hchen

customer_reviews.title: I Love gDiapers!
customer_reviews.text: gDiapers are the best......my baby has very sensitive skin and would break out in a rash all the time with disposables. He rarely has a rash now that we use g's full time. Amazon definately has the inserts for the cheapest when you use the auto ship, which I love......diapers are delivered to my door so I don't have to worry about running out!
customer_reviews.author: Resha

customer_reviews.title: gdiapers inserts
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers. Made the switch from disposables to gdiapers. Much easier on my daughter's bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Calicat

customer_reviews.title: I love gDiapers!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We exclusively use gDiapers for our 3 month old baby boy and we absolutely love them. They are so cute and comfy for our little guy and they are GOOD for the environment. I personally beleive that all diapers should have to be made disposable or biodegradable...there is no excuse!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Noble

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: Great to use when we are out of town and at night! Very absorbant and buying in bulk is actually cheaper than buying disposable diapers from the store! And better for my baby and the environment.
customer_reviews.author: melydia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the gdiapers lest waste and they seem to be more comfortable on the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jared A Warner

customer_reviews.title: gdiaper
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely wonderful product that is fully biodegradable and allows the baby's skin to breathe. There are minimal to no leaks at all and zero guilt.
customer_reviews.author: A. Park

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my dtr.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using gdiapers since babe was born. They work great for us. Poops can get a little messy, but inserts & diaper all wash easily. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Kruse

customer_reviews.title: better than traditional disposable diapers
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbent, better than traditional disposable diapers, especially overnight. Plus, no toxic chemicals on your baby's skin. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Probably would work fine in the G diaper cover but I read that I could try adding these to a disposable for overnight protection. Whoa-- that did not work at all. Too bad. We had to move on to a real overnight disposable (as much as I didn't want to....but at least they work).
customer_reviews.author: MamatoQuinn&Lindy

customer_reviews.title: These inserts work great!!
customer_reviews.text: We use another brand of cover and the insert works great. They are a bit large but we fold over on side a stuff at the insert.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Duck

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: So much more absorbent and better for the environment. Cloth diapering with these are really easy, gentle, and fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen's Mom

customer_reviews.title: gdiapers rock the earth!
customer_reviews.text: We love their convenience and earth friendly-ness. Joe has never had a diaper rash in 2 years. With the Amazon auto-order and the Moms discount, they are cheaper than disposables by far.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Petrash

customer_reviews.title: Love our gDiapers
customer_reviews.text: Love our gDiapers! I have used them with 2 out of my 3 children and will never go back to a stinky diaper pail ever again!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Zagrebin

customer_reviews.title: just covered my baby with gel :(
customer_reviews.text: I was very hopeful, but instead of absorbing waste as intended, these just left my daughter in a pool of urine and COVERED with little bits of gel. I thought maybe it was a bad liner, but multiple liners did this. Extremely unhappy with this.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, very good absorbing and happy to do lees harm to the earth!
customer_reviews.author: Verï¿½nica

customer_reviews.title: They work great
customer_reviews.text: I love these divers the only ones my daughter can use. no rash ever and they worked great. I recommend these diapers to any parent
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: If you pre-load the gDiaper shells with the inserts, you hardly even notice the extra step involved. They do leak ocassionally; but, my rule of thumbs is to change to my kiddo's diaper more frequently (than regular disposables) or double up on the inserts. I do double up on the inserts for over night. Also, I use the gDiaper inserts with both the gDiaper shells and the Grovia shells.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Gdiapers
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Gdiapers for over 2 years. 1st with my 2 yr old son and now w/ my 6 mo. daughter. Great product that's good for the environment!
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Reichard

customer_reviews.title: The next best thing
customer_reviews.text: The next best thing to cloth diapers. A great substitute when traveling. Easily flush or toss in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: greenmom

customer_reviews.title: Great! Love g diapers
customer_reviews.text: Great! Love g diapers. Have found the disposable inserts to be more absorbent than the cloth, making them great for overnights and travel.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G.

customer_reviews.title: Best liner ever
customer_reviews.text: So I use gdiAper pouches and love these! I have tried other brands but nothing works better then these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I was trying g diapers but found the rubber liner burns my baby's skin. I now have 4 packs of these that I can't use as intented. They don't hold a lot of urine but it is nice how biodegradable they are and convenient to dispose of. If the g diaoers had worked for us then I would certainly keep using these for daycare and trips out the house. I think I can use these as inserts for our other cloth diapers when baby is bigger (they are very long and have to be folded to fit a medium baby).
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Gdiapers are a nice idea. Maybe they work better for daytime wear on a mobile baby. My baby isn't crawling yet and overnights are very wet. She leaked through and the disposable wasn't even soaked. I would not buy these nor do I recommend Gdiapers. Not to mention how uncomfortable she looks. The band on the cover is not soft on her skin. Also, the snaps for the pouches leave red marks.
customer_reviews.author: cassie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for all my PUL covers!
customer_reviews.text: I use them in my kangaroos and other PUL shells, they fit perfect! Bigger then grovias disposable inserts, the entire pad edge to edge is exactly that a pad, no plastic edging like grovias, no sticky strip, over all I love them. My 2 year old doesn't pee through, super satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: We use these diaper inserts ALL THE TIME inside our ...
customer_reviews.text: We use these diaper inserts ALL THE TIME inside our cloth diaper covers. They fit more than just the Gpants. we used more cloth inserts with our first born, but our second is a heavy wetter and while I had two in diapers it was just easier to go with the disposable inserts. I had originally planned to only use these part time, as they are more expensive than regular disposable diapers, but ended up using them more than cloth. We have recently stopped ordering since they have gone up in price.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative
customer_reviews.text: We use regular old cloth diapers at home, but have been travelling a lot lately and these are a nice alternative. They are a little more expensive than pampers, but with Amazon's regular purchase feature, are a lot cheaper than retail. Our only beef with them is that the starter kit only has two cloth shells - three would be perfect. In their documentation, they recommend just switching them out, but if your baby gets a loose stool or is sick, you've got to wash one out in between - several times we found ourselves putting him in a damp, recently cleaned diaper cover. We rarely flush them, but the fact that you can is very comforting.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey K. Ericson

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Great option for traveling but don’t expect it to work like traditional disposables. Not quite as absorbing as using cloth or other diapers but does flush pretty easily so no carting around a poop filled diaper
customer_reviews.author: k burst

customer_reviews.title: Work great. Also add an extra layer of absorbency without ...
customer_reviews.text: We use these as a liner in our night time cloth diapers to protect them from the diaper creams that are not CD safe. Work great. Also add an extra layer of absorbency without adding a lot of bulk. Have only had one leak since using them and my daughter was sick with diarrhea. We have been able to stop using our wool and fleece covers over our pockets because we aren't having leaks anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: and we firmly believe that whatever small drawbacks they pose are worth it in the long run for the good of our landfills
customer_reviews.text: We've been using gDiapers for about two years, and we firmly believe that whatever small drawbacks they pose are worth it in the long run for the good of our landfills. We've seen firsthand how they disintegrate, and it makes us feel better knowing that what could be a huge impact per child on the environment is definitely mitigated by using gDiapers. We have occasional leaks (particularly at night, when I sometimes switch to conventional diapers), and it is extra work to wash and stuff the liners each time, but we feel good about what it does for the planet. Kudos to gDiapers for thinking outside the box when it comes to diaper solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Hoess

product_meta.title: gDiapers Disposable Inserts Case, Medium/Large/X-Large (13-36 lbs) (Pack of 4)
product_meta.description: Disposable Inserts fit snugly inside gDiapers soft, cotton gPants diaper covers and can be conveniently flushed, composted (wet ones only) or tossed. When the diaper is soiled, simply remove the disposable insert, dispose, and tuck in a new insert for a fresh change. Use the same gPant through multiple changes. Because Disposable Inserts contain no plastic sheeting, they can be safely flushed down the toilet in North America (following simple instructions), putting poop where it belongs; no smell, no mess, and no dirty diapers in the house. gDiapers. Disposable Inserts are the only baby product to be certified Cradle to Cradle (cm) Silver, which means everything that goes into them will be re-absorbed back into the eco-system in a neutral or beneficial way when composted (wet ones only). Hypoallergenic and free of elemental chlorine, latex, gluten, perfume, lotions and dyes, Disposable Inserts are made of cellulose, wood fluff pulp, and super absorber. Size N/S fits newborn and small gPants, size M/L/XL fits medium, large and x-large gPants. Disposable Inserts are made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Disposable Inserts fit snugly inside gDiapers soft, cotton gPants diaper covers and can be conveniently flushed, composted (wet ones only) or tossed

Made without plastic sheeting, Disposable Inserts can be safely flushed down the toilet in North America (following simple instructions), so there’s no smell, no mess, and no dirty diapers in the house

The only baby product to be certified Cradle to Cradle (cm) Silver, which means everything that goes into Disposable Inserts will be re-absorbed back into the eco-system in a neutral or beneficial way when composted (wet ones only)
Hypoallergenic Disposable Inserts are made of cellulose, wood fluff pulp, and super absorber and are free of elemental chlorine, latex, gluten, perfume, lotions and dyes
Size N/S (160 ct.) fits newborn and small gPants, size M/L/XL (128 ct.) fits medium, large and x-large gPants
